Fix https://github.com/apache/pulsar/issues/5015

The information is placed wrong. We can delete it from the current place.
I have a suggestion on this: while we delete the content from this place, we need to add more information. See suggestion at https://github.com/apache/pulsar/issues/5142

While I pull request on the modification today, I notice that @rocketraman has already pulled request for this issue, see https://github.com/apache/pulsar/pull/5143
While investigating the issue, I come up with the following structure:
- [x] Partitioned topic resources
  - [x] Create
  - [x] Get metadata
  - [x] Update
  - [x] Delete
  - [x] List
  - [x] Stats (not sure whether the content is same for partitioned and non-partitioned topics)
  - [x] Internal stats (not sure whether the content is same for partitioned and non-partitioned topics)

- [x] Nonpartitioned topic resources
  - [x] Create
  - [ ] Get metadata (need info)
  - [ ] Delete (need info)
  - [ ]  List (need info)

@sijie Could you help confirm whether I've understood it correctly? If yes, we need more modification on the topic.

https://github.com/apache/pulsar/pull/5162

@congbobo184 @codelipenghui 

I used joda, with the logical schema type. like 

```java
@AvroSchema("{\"type\":\"long\",\"logicalType\":\"timestamp-millis\"}")
public DateTime timestamp;
public String ownerid;
```

The output of `show columns from topic`

```sql
 timestamp.imillis    | bigint    |       |
 ownerid              | varchar   |       |
```

When I select this particular field I've got `Column 'timestamp.imillis' cannot be resolved` other fields (text, int) work well.

The `select *` works and outputs 

```sql
| timestamp.imillis |                  ownerid                  |
+-------------------+-------------------------------------------+
|     1568128483098 | orga_858600a8-74f4-4d75-a8a3-f5b368be093c |
|     1568128480098 | orga_858600a8-74f4-4d75-a8a3-f5b368be093c |
|     1568128481098 | orga_858600a8-74f4-4d75-a8a3-f5b368be093c |
|     1568128482098 | orga_858600a8-74f4-4d75-a8a3-f5b368be093c |
```

@cdbartholomew Thanks for the fix.  This may work for your test, but may not friendly for user setting. 
From my view the right logic could like this:
1. `workerConfig.isUseTls` is the main config. If user set  `workerConfig.isUseTls=true`, then we should comply with it.
2. once `workerConfig.isUseTls=true`, then it is expect that the broker has already has broker.conf configured with tls enabled and "webServicePortTls" with right value, 
3. For the reason analysed in  #4560,  function worker will create internal admin/client inside worker, it should passively config these:
```
brokerClientTlsEnabled=
brokerClientAuthenticationPlugin=
brokerClientAuthenticationParameters=
```

As you find above `workerConfig.isUseTls` is the main config that user wanted. and configs in 2 and 3 above, are some passively configs or configs that should comply with user's requirements.

@tuteng, who is work on fix for #4560.  
@jerrypeng, who init this worker config. 
@murong00, who also touched this part of code recently.
run Integration Tests

Here is my suggested solution: Merge and rewrite the original two file security-token-client.md and security-token-admin.md into a new security-jwt.md which links to the list item "JSON Web Token Authentication" in the file security-overview.md; adjust the related content in security-overview and unify the sidebar title into a similar format as much as possible.
Changes in security-overview.md:
![ 2019-09-11 11 42 00](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/44013755/64666613-7892b780-d489-11e9-9e63-5d6848aaec78.png)
Changes in sidebar:
![ 2019-09-11 11 46 21](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/44013755/64666764-ffe02b00-d489-11e9-8131-0079b2b6f58d.png)
and welcome better suggestions and opinions to discuss here~

Is there a possibility that `brokerToNamespaceToBundleRange` may be updated by other threads during the execution of the` removeMostServicingBrokersForNamespace()` method?
https://github.com/apache/pulsar/blob/01422476248d23741ff74f68e9cbd48ddf097108/pulsar-broker/src/main/java/org/apache/pulsar/broker/loadbalance/impl/LoadManagerShared.java#L260-L296

http://pulsar.apache.org/docs/en/functions-overview/#processing-guarantees
Does this link contain the info you want?
run integration tests

@jiazhai , thanks for the feedback. I agree with your comment about`workerConfig.isUseTls. Now that I think about it more, with the change I have proposed there is no way to use TLS for connecting to other brokers (especially geo-replicated ones) but to not use TLS for the function worker running locally with the broker. When running locally there is no need to encrypt the traffic, so the overhead may not be wanted. 

If I revert the change on line 163, then the user can choose whether to run the local function worker with TLS or not using the worker config. I will make that change and test it out.
@wolfstudy

Thank you but that document does not explains how the `--processing-guarantees` option affects source connectors.

For sink connectors using a value of `EFFECTIVELY_ONCE` changes the subscription mode to fail over, thus enabling the connector to retain message order. But I do not understand why is this an option for source connectors. I tried reading the source code without luck. Maybe the option is just there so developers can use it in source connectors if they need it.
run integration tests
run integration tests

I made the changed described above so that the function worker uses the useTls setting in function_worker.yml when running with the broker. I tested with the useTls on and off and it works in both cases.
